1.text: The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from Yahweh.

2.text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but Yahweh weighs the motives.

3.text: Commit your deeds to Yahweh, and your plans shall succeed.

4.text: Yahweh has made everything for its own end—yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.

5.text: Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to Yahweh: they shall certainly not be unpunished.

6.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for. By the fear of Yahweh men depart from evil.

7.text: When a man’s ways please Yahweh, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.

8.text: Better is a little with righteousness, than great revenues with injustice.

9.text: A man’s heart plans his course, but Yahweh directs his steps.

10.text: Inspired judgments are on the lips of the king. He shall not betray his mouth.

11.text: Honest balances and scales are Yahweh’s; all the weights in the bag are his work.

12.text: It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, for the throne is established by righteousness.

13.text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings. They value one who speaks the truth.

14.text: The king’s wrath is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.

15.text: In the light of the king’s face is life. His favor is like a cloud of the spring rain.

16.text: How much better it is to get wisdom than gold! Yes, to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.

17.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil. He who keeps his way preserves his soul.

18.text: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.

19.text: It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor, than to divide the plunder with the proud.

20.text: He who heeds the Word finds prosperity. Whoever trusts in Yahweh is blessed.

21.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent. Pleasantness of the lips promotes instruction.

22.text: Understanding is a fountain of life to one who has it, but the punishment of fools is their folly.

23.text: The heart of the wise instructs his mouth, and adds learning to his lips.

24.text: Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

25.text: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.

26.text: The appetite of the laboring man labors for him; for his mouth urges him on.

27.text: A worthless man devises mischief. His speech is like a scorching fire.

28.text: A perverse man stirs up strife. A whisperer separates close friends.

29.text: A man of violence entices his neighbor, and leads him in a way that is not good.

30.text: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, one who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.

31.text: Gray hair is a crown of glory. It is attained by a life of righteousness.

32.text: One who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; one who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city.

33.text: The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from Yahweh.
